activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kraig R Johnstone

defendant.name: Johnstone, Kraig R
defendant.address: Northeast Regional Corrections Center 6102 Abraham, Saginaw, MN 55779

records.addlTxt:
9:01 AM Defendant Kraig R Johnstone appeared by video, in custody, NE Regional Correcitonal.  Attorney Kaitlin Elizabeth Dippolito appeared by video for Kraig R Johnstone.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Formal reading of Information waived.  
Attorney Dippolito requests Preliminary hearing and waives time limits.
Next hearing may be by zoom.  JA to make arragements.
Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with Rice Lake Kohls store.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. 
Must not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed to him.

9:04 AM Defendant Kraig R Johnstone appeared by video, in custody, at NE regional Correctional Center, MN.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter appeared by Zoom video means. 
Defendant has called the PD office.
9:08 AM Attorney Kitto and Defendant in a breakout room.
9:17 AM Attorney Kitto and Defendant back from breakout room.
Attorney Kitto relates Defendant does qualify for PD. 
Court finds good cause for adjournment
Next hearing may be by zoom.
JA to make arrangements.
Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.
